intro: Helianthus trachelifolius, commonly known as the roughleaf sunflower, is a species of flowering plant in the sunflower family, Asteraceae. It is native to the southeastern United States and is characterized by its rough, hairy leaves and yellow to orange flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as wetlands and prairies. Its scientific name reflects its distinctive leaf structure, with "trachelifolius" referring to its rough or rugged foliage. Helianthus trachelifolius is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
